body:
I have created a library to **hook** and **fix** this BadTokenException:

https://github.com/drakeet/ToastCompat

If acceptable, I can submit a PR.

I supplied the _Why_ and _How_ for this exception:

https://github.com/drakeet/ToastCompat/blob/master/README.md#why

Is there any more info on this?  I'm attempting to use Leak Canary right now and although I've got four 'leaks' found, each one is for a Toast - and these are for activities that don't use Toasts.  I'm assuming Leak Canary is just reporting on itself here, which undermines its usefulness as a tool.

Am I doing something wrong? 
Is there a way to stop Leak Canary attempting to show toasts? 
Why is it showing toasts for activities that are destroyed? 
Does it show toasts when the activity has leaked anyway, so are these activities actually leaking?
<details>
<summary>screenshots</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5053926/40845899-e6c42454-65af-11e8-8424-66cd3fe3ec5b.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5053926/40845868-d661998e-65af-11e8-955f-9e8e6457ad76.png)
</details>

2 issues here:

1) Toasts can apparently crash on API 25. Not easy to fix, it seems like a solution similar to ToastCompat should work but I'd rather not add any external dependency. Maybe we should consider moving from the toast to pure notification? Not sure.

2) Toasts appear in memory leaks, and developers claim the toasts are causing a leak, when in fact we don't know what's causing the leak. The cause of a leak can be any element of the leak trace.

Potential solution for 1. is to add the toast view directly ourselves to the window manager, similar to this: https://github.com/pyricau/frenchtoast/blob/master/frenchtoast/src/main/java/frenchtoast/Mixture.java#L49

Another option is to remove the toast and rely on notifications only, but I'm afraid that might cause pain because testers of the app will wonder why the UI is frozen.

issue.title: Avoid Toast crashes

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
Showing a toast can crash on API 25 because the Window Manager can throw a BadTokenException when addView is called.

This change fixes it by configuring the toast manually and calling the window manager directly. This is based on https://github.com/pyricau/frenchtoast/blob/master/frenchtoast/src/main/java/frenchtoast/Mixture.java#L49 .

Fixes #844
